Liberty University has there own police department. They recently made a four way stop for an intersection that was seemingly unsafe for students crossing the street. They are always looking out for the best for everyone.

There are so many clubs that you can join. There is the pre-med club, family and consumer science club, pro-life club, break dancing club, chemistry club, and so so so many more! The Student Activities department plans events almost every weekend for students to attend. From concerts to shows to carnivals, there will be something planned for everyone!

Students who want to have a social life but also take school seriously will thrive at Liberty University. There are so many opportunities to make close friendships while also being able to pursue a worthwhile degree. Liberty University is the largest Christian university in the world. This atmosphere is so extraordinary that you will not find it anywhere else.

Liberty University awards a large amount of scholarships to incoming freshmen that have worked hard in high school. Students with high GPAs and standardized test scores will be rewarded accordingly. There are so many amazing facilities that are available to students that this college experience will be so unlike any other place. The money that each student is responsible is so worth it because of all of the amazing moments that students get to be a part of.

The LaHaye Student Union is a very nice facility. It is a full gym with a cardio room, basketball and volleyball courts, weight rooms, and more. Next to east campus, there are outdoor sand volleyball courts that are great places to meet new friends. There are plenty of places in town to visit such as the dollar movie theater, Sweet Frog frozen yogurt, and the Blue Ridge Mall. The Liberty sports games are certainly the most exciting games around. From football to soccer, field hockey and lacrosse, Liberty's sports are the best.

From Dunkin Donuts to Doc's Diner, there is something on campus that everyone will like. The main cafeteria on campus is the Reber-Thomas Dining Hall. It has so much variety. There is a Chick-fil-a and a Subconnection, which is similar to Subway. The Bistro is a very convenient place for sandwiches on the go. There is a nice Starbucks in the bookstore and Jazzman's coffee shop in the library.

Living on a hall can be one of the greatest experiences at Liberty University. With prayer leaders, student life directors, resident advisors, and resident directors, all students are placed under a group of responsible student leaders that genuinely care about them. Every hall plans individual activities, either with themselves or with your brother dorm.

Whether you choose to be a part of the Honors Program or not, Liberty's academics should be taken very seriously. Liberty has an excellent Honors Program. Everyone is taught the same things, but Honors students get a chance to do a little extra in order to show their knowledge of the material. Most students are not Honors students, and still have to work hard for their grades.

Be excited for convocation. You will get to hear some of the greatest speakers in the world talk about topics that they are fired up about. As a freshmen, choose to live on a hall so that you will be able to meet friends right from the start. It is harder to make friends in apartment-style living, although it is definitely still a nice option to have on campus. Take advantage of all of the concerts and activities that are planned. Liberty's Student Activities office is so creative and resourceful when it comes to having fun. Lastly, don't get too wrapped up in all of the fun activities and speakers. Take your classes seriously because your professors care about your education and you personally more than you know.

Liberty University has a strong, Christian atmosphere that fills the campus with God's joy and love. It is a very large community of students, but between hall activities, intramural sports, and certain small classes, finding friends is made much less stressful. The facilities on Liberty's campus are phenomenal, and convocation is an enjoyable break from everyday classes.

textAfterTable: Bang for the buck After adding everything up on the college necessity list, it's normal to stress and need to step away to catch your breath, but with Liberty you can feel extremely secure in knowing that every penny is going to a strong establishment that is 110% focused on your future. Yes, its a private, Christian University, but its worth every penny. You have some of the best educators in the country at this school and amazing programs that will challenge you in every aspect of your major, but it doesn't stop there! Every Monday, Wednesday and Friday, we have something called Convocation, which is pretty much like a HUGE chapel for the entire campus to come together and hear encouraging words from famous authors, musicians, artists, pastors, athletes and missionaries. So, on top of the great professors, we are taught even more by the visitors also interested in our callings. There's a gym, ice skating rink, basketball courts, an indoor track, indoor soccer and basketball arena, plus computer labs, curriculum libraries...EVERYTHING you could ask for. An additional plus about Liberty is the willingness to help in any way possible financially. Depending on one's major, their family's income, and even educational achievments like honor roll or high GPA, Liberty offers many scholarships in order to decrease financial burden. Am enjoying being here The campus
